title: Hebrew Pair for Poetica?
content:
I'm looking for a Hebrew typeface to pair with Poetica. I know this may be hard since it's a chancery italic but I was hoping one of you guys may have an idea. Below is a sample for your reference.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317073747im_/http:/typophile.com/files/adobe-2_4820.gif)

Side discussion: Did anything ever happen with Eric Gill's Hebrew typeface? Has it been digitized? I read on a blog it has been but was unable to find a version of it.
author: Gershon

comments.content:
Sadly Gill's Hebrew has indeed been digitized...

hhp

Traditionally Hebrew does not use this kind of decorative approach.

Have a look at [http://www.typophile.com/node/35367](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317073747/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35367 "http://www.typophile.com/node/35367") if you must!  
Also at David, [http://typophile.com/node/90718](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317073747/http:/typophile.com/node/90718 "http://typophile.com/node/90718") especially the inclined forms.

To compound your problems, Hebrew does not naturally incline to the right.  
Modern Hebrew fonts that do incline to the right are offering almost a strong  
maybe aggressive 'in your face' kind of emphasis quite unlike traditional italian italics.  
Mike

(Stay away from Gill. He did not understand Hebrew.)
